Name: Monopolization
Description:
Players take the role of farmers in Wisconsin after the industrial revolution that are expanding into new areas of the business world.

REAL ESTATE
Players travel around Wisconsin and purchase and sell real estate for their companies. Each type of property has a different purpose. They are: railroads, shops, inns, banks, forests, mines, farms, factories, and harbours.

PRICE MANAGEMENT
Presidents of companies can adjust the prices at their properties that may be utilized by other players. They may sell low to attract business or undersell competition, or sell high if they have a monopoly in a particular business.

TRAVELLING
Players try to avoid shops and inns that are too expensive while on their business trips, and visit other cities using the railroad, again trying to avoid overpriced trips.

ANTITRUST LEGISLATION
Players can also visit the capital building in Madison in an attempt to set legal limits on prices in certain industries.

SHARE TRADING AND TAKEOVERS
Presidents of companies can buy and sell shares of stock of other players' companies. This can be done for profit or to attempt a company takeover.

—description from the designer

Name: Dino Volcano
Description:
"The petrifying prehistoric race game"

Throw the dice to try to escape the lava. Each round the lava creeps further, and you have to score enough and not get stuck on 'bad' squares in order to keep ahead. The one that gets their dinosaur to the end first without being caught by the lava flow is the winner.

A little like Snakes and Ladders with lava making the board smaller every turn.

Contents:
    6 x Dinosaur Piece's
    12 x Lava Piece's
    9 x Jigsaur Game Board Piece's
    2 x Interlocking Volcano Piece's
    1 x Die
    1 x Timer

—user summary

Name: Pippi Langstrumpf: Perlenjagd
Description:
Pippi Longstocking Pearl Hunt

Pippi and the two thieves go fishing for pearls: Roll a die to grab pearls, steal from the other player or bring your cargo to safety in your treasure chest.

Game ends as soon as all pearls are collected. Party with the most pearls wins.

Competitive variant for 2 players. 
Cooperative variant for 1-many children.
—user summary

Pippi Langstrumpf Perlenjagd

Die Jagd auf die Südsee-Perlen ist eröffnet. Gemein nur, dass ständig die Diebe Jim und Buck ihre Langfinger im Spiel haben.
—description from the publisher

Name: Party & Co Cardgame
Description:
Travel version of Party & Co.
You don't need a playing board!

Party & Co card game is a game for 4 or more players.
A team consist of a minimum of 2 players.

One of the teams rolls the dice and takes a card. On every card there are 4 challenges, every category 1 challenge.
There are 4 categories: Art&Co, Show&Co, Quiz&Co and Crazy&Co.

You have 30 seconds for completing a challenge.
Before you start the challenge you can place a bet per team.
For example the challenge is: How many cartoon figures can you draw? Then each team can place a bet (bonus card) on that challenge. The team that wins collects the bonus cards.

The goal of the game is to collect 10 bonus cards.

—user summary

Name: 拉斯維加斯 Las Vegas
Description:
In Las Vegas, each player has eight dice of a different color, which they take turns rolling. When you roll your dice, you can choose to place them on the relevant casino cards; for example, a die showing a 1 will be placed on the casino mat marked "1". You must place all dice of one number on one casino in your turn. All players take turns doing this until all the dice have been used. Finally, the player with the most dice on each casino card takes the money associated with it. In case of a tie, the next non-tied player takes the highest-valued money card at that casino.

The Boulevard expansion includes:
    Eight dice in two new colors to allow for up to seven players.
    A purple die for each player that allows you to remove an opponent's or own die when placed (with enough purple dice to have up to eight players).
    A large die in each color, except purple, that counts as two dice when determining who scores at a casino.
    Two white dice to play the basic variant with up to 7 players.
    Rules for playing a solitaire version of the game.
    Rules for playing a variant of the game.
    Bills worth $100,000.
    Bills worth $50,000 for each bill of a specific color you collect.
    One-shot action cards, with each player receiving one such card at the start of each round.
    Special cards of variable random value.
    A new, seventh casino; on a turn, a player can place all the dice he rolled of a single number in this casino, but then no more dice of this number can be placed in this casino by any player.

Name: The Binding of Isaac: Four Souls +
Description:
A tuckbox expansion to The Binding of Isaac: Four Souls, a tabletop card game about sacrifice, betrayal and hoarding. Inspired by the massive hit video game The Binding of Isaac. This expansion adds more monsters, items, and characters from the video game.

Dive even further into the haunted and harrowing world of The Binding of Isaac: Four Souls in this expansion. Collect treasure, gather loot, defeat monsters, and be the first to collect four souls. With 90 new cards to play with there's even more replay-ability to offer. Discover killer combos, enhance your abilities, betray your companions and win!

The Game includes:
- 30 monster cards
- 22 loot cards
- 30 treasure cards
- 4 character cards and 4 starting items

Name: The Duke: Reinforcements – Gunpowder Uprising
Description:
8 new tiles for The Duke!

After players select their bags of Troops Tiles and the gameboard is setup, they take their appropriate-colored tiles from Gunpowder Uprising and add them to their bags.

Name: GIPF: Das TAMSK-Potential
Description:
The TAMSK potential
TAMSK is an independent game independent of GIPF and should always be considered as such. But within the project GIPF it makes even more sophisticated with its pieces, the TAMSK potentials, GIPF: You bring them into the GIPF game, but do not yet know whether you can use them or not. They can be beaten or neutralized, yes, it may even be that you can not use them at all. But as long as they are on the board, they pose a threat to the opponent. You will be amazed how a TAMSK potential affects your strategy and that of your opponent.

Apparently this new (2019) product contains 6 TAMSK potentials. The base game TAMSK includes 6 TAMSK potentials. The first GIPF expansion GIPF Project Set 1 (from 2001) contains 12 TAMSK potentials, so this new product seems intended to let TAMSK owners have the recommended full set of 12 TAMSK potentials without having to buy the earlier expansion with 12 of them.

Name: Supertall: Municipal Buildings
Description:
You can't fight City Hall, but you can work with them. Municipal Buildings allows Supertall to be played with 4 players, and gives expanded options for 2 and 3 player games.

Adds 6 new - 4 Government plans plus an additional Business plan and Natural plan.  The new government plans score 3 points per odd value of 3 points per even value.


Released in the July 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $20+ package, together with Supertall.

Name: All Aboard: Around the World Train Game
Description:
This appears to be a simple roll-and-move game, with the theme of world railway travel, and based on an oval board game.

From the description on the back of the box:

First class, non-stop family fun from London to Rio via Delhi and Sydney!

Travel in style, stopping off at exotic locations to take in the sights. Watch out for obstacles that will slow down your journey, like leaves on the line, and hope to be sped up by express routes.

Set Up
Each passenger boards their train by placing a train token at the start of the train track.

How to Play
Passengers take turns in a clockwise order; youngest passenger starts. On your turn, roll the dice and move forward that many spaces. If you land on a space with text on it, read out the text and follow the instruction. If you throw a '6' you do not get another turn.

Winning
The first passenger to reach the end of the line and complete their journey wins. Keep playing until all trains have pulled in.

Contents: 
1 x game board
1 x die
8 x train tokens [blue, brown, green, pink, purple, orange, red, yellow]

Name: Random Narrative Game
Description:
Random Narrative Game is an interactive, choose your own adventure style, group storytelling game. Players work together to create a cohesive story based on the setting, pathways, and choices presented to them. The twist is all choices are determined by luck and the roll of a dice.

—description from the designer

Name: Idi-umms
Description:
Let's not beat around the bush. Sometimes you need to let off some steam, right? This may be a far cry from your typical card game, but give us the benefit of the doubt, huh?
Now, I don't wanna let the cat out of the bag, but you really should jump on this bandwagon and take our game for a spin!
You may think we're not playing with a full deck, but there is a method to our madness. So get off the fence before you miss the boat and join us for a game of Idi-umms...

Idi-umms is a fast-paced, fill-in-the-blank card game where players compete to see who can earn the most points by recreating idioms using the word cards in their hand.

—description from the designer

Name: Beg, Borrow & Steal: The Light Edition
Description:
Do you like collecting things?
     Do you ever beg your friends to give you things?
     Do you regularly borrow things and never return them?
     Have you considered stealing things you want?


If any or all these things are true, then THIS is the game for you!
In Beg, Borrow & Steal players collect sets of 3 identical cards by taking cards from other players or stealing them from the draw pile. The player with the most completed collections when the Steal pile runs out wins! Some people work hard to achieve success, but in this game, you have to Beg, Borrow, and Steal to succeed!


    Both The Light Edition and the Dark Edition can be played separately or together as an expanded version of the game. Each game is perfect for 3-4 players in normal play mode. When combined the game can accommodate up to 8 players in normal play mode or 3-6 players in challenging mode.


—description from the designer

Name: Deckfighters: Mixed Martial Arts Card Game Expansion – Purple Edition
Description:
New cards, new categories, new abilities. Adds 12 cards to the standard DECKFIGHTERS deck. Each expansion pack increases the numbers of players by 2.

—description from the publisher

Name: Shadows: Amsterdam – Tournament Promo Tile #2
Description:
Promo tile for Shadows: Amsterdam distributed during tournaments.

Frontside depicting a team of 6 celebrating a victory.
Each team member has a shining golden medal and one member is holding the big trophy above his head.

Backside depicting the silhouette of a signpost and mailbox against the backdrop of a city with orange sky.

Tile can be shuffled in with the other tiles.

Name: Shadows: Amsterdam – Tournament Promo Tile #1
Description:
Promo tile for Shadows: Amsterdam distributed during tournaments.

Frontside depicting four seagulls playing a game of Dice Forge.

Backside depicting the silhouette of a signpost and mailbox against the backdrop of a city with orange sky.

Tile can be shuffled in with the other tiles.

Name: Starfarm Ceres
Description:
It is the distant future, the year 2000. Mankind has colonised all of the rocky planets of the inner solar system. However Ceres, deep in the heart of the Asteroid Belt, remains a distant and desolate outpost even after the industrial process used to create fertile soils and an oxygen-rich atmosphere.

You are one of a few hardy (some would say fool-hardy) galactic pioneers who have sunk everything they own into a patch of Cerean land and a handful of 'bots to tend and defend it. For the rapidly growing crops of Ceres fetch premium prices back on flooded, overpopulated Earth. Meanwhile the warlike colonies of Mars, intent on their independence from Earth, continue to blockade and harass Cerean shuttles. Will you make your fortune and retire to the balmy resorts of Venus? Or will the challenges of Starfarm Ceres overwhelm and ruin you?

Starfarm Ceres is a worker placement solitaire game divided across three game boards. On the first, you deploy your 'bots to sow crops and harvest them once they mature using a unique time delay mechanism. On the second you must shoot down Martian saucers that multiply and descend to raze your crops. Finally you must send shuttles back to Earth, through the Martian blockade, to the third board where you sell your produce and buy upgrades. The language-independent game boards are double-sided with slightly different scenarios on each, giving eight different game setup possibilities.

—description from the designer

Name: Master of the Galaxy: The Weavers
Description:
Torn by endless rivalry of species, each vying for their own supremacy, the galaxy is now in ruin. Once glorious factions are now either gone in the mist of time or shut in their homeworlds. There could not be worse time for invasion of mysterious Weavers.

Their Swarms are coming from another plane to enveil and reave whole star systems. Millions of small spacecrafts weave the network of uncanny glimmering constructions. Once their work is done, stars and planets vanish from our universe without a trace. Then Weavers Swarms move on and on, consuming whole clusters on their way.

Your only hope is to unite what species remain in the galaxy and banish Weavers before they can complete their sinister webbing.

The Weavers is an expansion allowing you to play Master of the Galaxy solo, including a deck of solo cards and rules.

Name: Whiskey Row: A Wild West Strategy Game
Description:
In this Wild West town the stakes are high as every last one of you worthless lawbreakers are WANTED DEAD OR ALIVE for reckless and criminal behavior and are fugitives on the run. You must navigate the dangerous streets surrounding the Courthouse in order gather your posse together, escape capture and rule the town. Your posse of fugitives will attempt to round up reluctant and disloyal accomplices—trying to keep them in tow to accomplish their ill-conceived agendas. Beware, your accomplices can be taken from you at any moment, you may be hauled off to jail or even challenged to a duel.

The Wild West in 1879 was ripe with lawlessness. But in the vast Arizona wilderness the town of Prescott grew even wilder. A row of saloons cropped up and took over an entire street. They coined it "Whiskey Row."

After much drinking and gambling, reckless and criminal behavior ensued. The townsfolk dueled it out with their six shooters on the dusty streets—each acting as judge and jury. The souls of those shot in cold blood haunted the town.

With opposing ill-conceived agendas, the townsfolk divided into four renegade posses and all became FUGITIVES of the law.
The unruly CITIZENS, 
The dishonest MERCHANTS, 
The brutal OUTLAWS 
& The corrupt local LAW.

2-8 players each use four real poker chip Wild West characters (their posse) to move around the board by choosing to play one of two 'wanted dead or alive' cards or roll two dice with an option of splitting the dice to move TWO characters. Each player has a posse of four. For instance, the Outlaws have the Gunslinger, the Madame, the Dealer and the Bartender. As they move through the streets of this dangerous town, strategic options are chosen to decide which of your opponents players you choose to force into being your reluctant accomplices by stacking them under your own posse's fugitives—you will need them to escape the law and win the game. The cards list a group of four wanted fugitives for a particular crime, so you may choose one from your own posse, OR one of your opponents, thereby giving you the chance to move an opponent's fugitive and waylay their attempts to win the game. Duels may be called before each turn in order to steal your opponents accomplices, kidnapping the Marshal or the Judge keeps you protected from capture and sending an opponent to the jailhouse or a haunted property slows down their ability to escape capture.

Although there are at least five strategic choices to choose from during each turn, the game moves along quickly. During another player's turn there is much to think about, so you are engaged the entire time. All players remain in the game until it concludes and there is no clear winner until it pans out in the end—with one player's posse escaping caputure by returning to their individual hideouts...with the help of their accomplices.

-description from designer

Name: Kam'on
Description:
You may find KAM’ON interesting for one particular reason- you can scam. Although this turns out to be incredibly interesting and allows for millions of different scenarios, plays, and manipulation, KAM’ON has many other aspects and cards that give it a quite perfect balance between fun, complexity and possibilities. For example, take poker, a game that is not too complex yet allows for so many different plays on account of the player/human factor of the game; players can manipulate others, bluff, etc. KAM’ON is very similar, although frankly our cards look a bit nicer.

Having tens of distinct cards lets the player combine different plays, playing as many cards as they  would like during their turn, yet only playing one card per type. The true intrigue comes when you realise that you may not make it without trading- or scamming. You decide to bluff. You lie about having a card that another player needs only to scam him out of a card you need. A player may only complete their part of the trade during their own turn, therefore it is quite easy to scam someone- at the cost of your in game reputation.

This aspect of KAM’ON works perfectly with the beautifully designed cards that work to get you your 4 organs- the cards needed to win. In all honesty, KAM’ON is quite simple. Do everything you can to get 4 organs, whether it be destroying your opponents and stealing their organs, or scamming them out of their organs. Whichever it is, as long as you get an organ, it was probably worth it.

—description from the publisher

Name: Hempels Sofa
Description:
There's so much junk in Hempel's house! And right in the middle of it all is Hugo Hempel, who is making his way through the chaos.

In Hempels Sofa, the players try to help him reach the objects they are looking for. To do this, they need to keep track of things, have a good memory, and not step on each other's stuff. The first player to pick up four objects wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Porca Vacca!
Description:
The game revolves around a single Deck (and the Discard Pile) from which, at turn, each player draws a card. The aim is not to end your turn with more than 4 cards in your hand, but at the same time to keep some to attack your opponents or defend yourself.
—description from the designer

Il gioco si sviluppa attorno a un singolo mazzo (e alla pila degli scarti) da cui tutti i giocatori, a turno, pescano una carta. Lo scopo è non arrivare mai alla fine del proprio turno con più di 4 carte in mano, ma contemporaneamente tenerne qualcuna da poter giocare per ostacolare gli avversari e difendersi dai loro attacchi.
—description from the designer (translated)

Name: Jean Paul Sartre's No Exit
Description:
Jean Paul Sartre's No Exit is a 3 player Print and Play game taking roughly 5-10 minutes per round. Players move their strangers to one of several sofas then score at the end of each round if the right strangers are on the right sofas to fulfill their personal motivations. It is almost impossible to avoid repeated stalemates unless you manage to manipulate and persuade the other players. With nothing to offer or threaten you must convince them to act against their own best interests.

Jean Paul Sartre's No Exit is themed as a boardgame recreation of the play No Exit by the French philosopher Jean Paul Sartre. It is the source of his most famous misquotation "Hell is other people".

—description from the publisher

Name: Split the Loot
Description:
After successfully raiding a commercial galleon, it's time to split the loot! As one of the pirates, you want to get the most valuable treasures. But the whole crew must agree how to divide the booty. Convince your companions that your share is really not so big...

Split the Loot is a card game in which during each round players divide treasures (16-18 cards each round) using an unique "reversed bidding" mechanic. The active player makes an offer stating which cards he would like to take and places bid markers on them. The other players in clockwise turn order either accept the offer or make an counteroffer by removing the markers from the cards; as you can only remove markers the counteroffer will be a subset of the initial offer. Once all players agree to an offer the bidding player gathers the cards with markers on them and drops out off the round while the other players continue to divide in the same manner the cards available in this round .

Besides gathering treasures player may gain action cards that provide a one time bonus during the game.

The game ends when players divide among themselves the whole Treasure Deck, which depending on the number of players will take between 5 and 7 rounds. The players count up the points from their gained cards. Different cards score in different ways - while you want as much Rum as you can gather, if you found a couple Cannon balls you really should look around for a Cannon...

While the card titles are printed in Polish the game is totally language independent and the rules are printed in both English and Polish.

—description from the publisher

Name: Eye Found It!: Despicable Me
Description:
Hop in Lucy's car and join the Minions on a wild road trip through the world of Despicable Me, from Gru's lab and Paradise Mall, to Minion Beach and more! Along the way, search for hidden objects; there are over 1,000 things to find! With the help of fellow players, race to the end of the giant 1.80m game board before the amusement park closes to win!
—description from the publisher

Name: ¡Apuren el Corralito!: The Second Battle of Alihuatá, December 1933
Description:
Apuren el Corralito! is a two player print and play, free game depicting the climactic battle of 2nd Alihuatá (Dec. 1933), during the Chaco War between Paraguay and Bolivia (1932-35), which ended with the surrender of the bulk of the Bolivian army in a clearing of the “chaco” bush known as Campo Vía, and resulted in the first truce in the war.

The game is a Battalion level simulation, the map depicts a 30 x 35 mile area (each hex is 1mile aprox.) and turns are 1 day each (the battle lasted for 10 days). The game includes:


     280 two sided counters.
     Four A4 sheets map. (Or 1 x A2 map).
     One air placement auxiliary sheet.
     One rulebook with playing aides.


Although the battle was mainly a one sided business, with the Paraguayan conducting three successive envelopments (thanks to initial Bolivian command sclerosis and lack of reserves), the Bolivian player still has a lot to do, husbanding his forces and trying to save as much as he can from the Paraguayan onslaught.

On the other side, the Paraguayan player must at least accomplish what historically was done: envelope and force to surrender two, out of three, Bolivian divisions and tear down the front, forcing his opponent to abandon the battle area. And this means having the noose tightened up to the end, and sticking to a strict schedule.

Being the Chaco an extensive bush country, intelligence on your enemy is a key to carrying out enveloping maneuvers. Remember that this was ”MG time” and you couldn’t just walk naively into an entrenched killing ground. The game provides rules for intelligence gathering in order to simulate surprise.

—description from the designer

Name: First Battle
Description:
First Battle is Real War Game Simulation created by the US Army, Fort Leavenworth, Kansas, USA. this version is 75 pages in total; 53 pages of Rules; 13 pages of Tally Sheets; etc.

The military units are meant to represented by user created, folded tent cards, with a military symbol on one side. In the "Open-Mode" configuration of this simulation each Team has a wall-mounted 1:50k planning map and the Simulation is played out on a table-mounted 1:25k map, divided into 2x3' sectors (roughly 10ft. across and 12ft. between the Divisional commanders). Each side has 3 Div. Commanders; 3 Artillery Commanders, 2 Operational Leaders; an Overall Commander; and an Operational Aide (22 people in total). To run the run the "Closed-Mode" a total of 55+ people are required. In the "Closed" version the Commanders are in a separate room from the Simulation and have status updates conveyed by written notes of brief, one-way, phone messages. HO scale miniatures (Roco) are typically used in the "Closed" version, so that limited "Aerial" photos (or sketches) can be requested. Combat is resolved through Dice-Rolling in a fashion similar to most commercial wargames of the era.

This is obviously more than your typical war-game, but it is a streamlined version of actual military simulations used by the US Army in the 1970's.

—user summary

Name: FiveCore Brigade Commander: Brigade Level Warfare in the 20th Century
Description:
FiveCore Brigade Commander: Brigade Level Warfare in the 20th Century. By Ivan Sorensen. While the rules are not written for any particular scale of miniatures, they will work very well with 3mm, 6mm and 10mm figures, where each stand can look like a unit in its own right. Playing in 15mm is certainly possible, but tank models will take up a disproportionate amount of table-space compared to infantry stands.

GROUND AND TIME SCALE:
The game does not adhere to a strict time scale. A turn is the time it takes for a meaningful action to take place on the gaming table and for units to potentially incapacitate an enemy company sized formation. Depending on the actions taking place, this may be from a few minutes to half an hour or longer. If you are tracking time for the purposes of a scenario, assume an average of 10 minutes per turn or roll 3D6 each turn, to determine how many minutes it took. Think of your game as a movie. As the battle rages, the camera zooms in on a particular unit and focuses on it, while the rest of the world ceases to exist for a moment. Ground scale is roughly 1” = 100 yards.
Engagement distances have been kept very conservative, to account for the fact that our flat, featureless tables would be covered in hedge rows, hills, crevices and depressions.

Name: Le Franc Tireur #14: Italians
Description:
This issue focuses on the Italians, from the invasion of France to the Greek mountains, from Eritrea to Abyssinia or Somalia, Yugoslavia, Ukraine, but also Sicily and even China. Also included, two countersheets and 32 scenarios, thus a thicker issue than our regular LFT mag with, this time, 104 pages.

Content:

- Editor’s Foreword 
- Advancing Fire (an Italian project for ASL) 
- 10 questions to ECZ
- LFT Humor 
- Villeneuve 2018 
- The Bulgarian Armor 1944 
- The Decima MAS 
- I gruppi di Combattimento 
- SS Italia 
- Lighting Strikes: the Folgore Division 
- Birds of Prey: Aerial support in ASL 
- Italians in ASL 
- Series Replay: LFT 214 A Grain of Sand
- Bibliography

Name: Roll Player: Minotaur Promo Punchboard
Description:
One punchboard that includes:


     Double-sided (Male/Female) Minotaur Race Character Sheet
     10 Gold Coins

Name: Everworld
Description:
Everworld is a narrative, tactical combat RPG for 2-4 players with an emphasis on moral decisions and story development of the characters. It is based on a fantasy setting where high magic is forbidden and heroes have been forgotten.

Heroes play against the game system, using AI decks for enemies and 9 skill cards for their turns. They have also to bet for results when resolving events and taking moral decisions. They win if they achieve each mission objectives, and they lose if they all fall exhaust.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sudokiller
Description:
Sudokiller is a sudoku based deduction game about a detective chasing a serial killer. One player takes up the role of the detective, the other the role of the serial killer. The killer secretly writes down two numbers between 1 and 6, one for themself and one for their preferred victim. 
Now both players take turn to place a number on one of the six fields of one of the six empty "crime scenes". At any time after the placement of the 16th number, the detective can ask a question like "Has a murder been committed in these areas?" and point to one or more crime scenes. The killer must truthfully answer yes if they placed the killer number in a crime scene where the victim number was already present, otherwise they answer no. The detective can ask this kind of question three times in the course of the game. 
The detective wins if
- at some point they can make a correct accusation, naming both the killer's and the victim's number
- the killer fails to murder anyone at all.
The killer wins if
- the detective makes a wrong accusation
- no more cubes can be played, and they have committed at least one murder.

Name: Frontier: Enchanted Land
Description:
What is Frontier?

Frontier is a card drafting, town building game for 2-5 players set in a circa 17th century rural magic land.
You are a town builder and, after the destruction of your home, you have traveled far in search of a new land filled with mystery and opportunities.   
You are joined by other town builders at the start of your journey to build a new home.
A game of Frontier lasts for approximately 30 minutes.

How to Play!

A game of Frontier is split into two phases, a draft phase and a build phase. During the draft phase players will draft a total of 13 cards to create their hand of cards for the build phase. During the draft phase players draft building cards and advanced resource cards, with the goal of collecting card that work well together in synergy.

The build phase lasts over 8 rounds, in which players will gather resources and build the cards picked during the draft phase. The game ends at the end of the 8th round. The winner is the player who has gathered the most points at the end of the game, which will require skill and strategy during both the draft and building phases.

Good luck on your adventure Town Builders!

—description from the designer

Name: Raging Bull Rodeo
Description: Slide the switch to the left and take it in turns to load up the bull, by positioning accessories strategically as you don't want them to fall off. Flick the switch and watch Bronco Bill try and stay on. Count how many accessories have stayed on the raging bull and the player with the most left wins! Contents include: Raging bull, Bronco Bill, saddle, 12 x hook on accessories and stickers.

Name: Expedition to the Temple of Bir Tawil
Description:
You are trying to reach the desert temple of Bir Tawil, moving through locations on the map with limited resources. Water and Fuel are essential, as is having Gold to trade with. Your path is guided by a magical device powered by Crystals, and is vital if you want to discover treasures or avoid bandit raids.

Through the course of the game you move along a map, with each space demanding different resources in order to travel. Most of the action happens on the action compass, a rondel-like track where each turn 1 or more bandits will move around blocking your actions. You will then be moving the resource dice around the action compass in order to gather resources.

The central game elements focus on engine building, resource management and dice manipulation. The effects of the dice rolls happen in future turns, and part of the challenge of the game is working out how best to manipulate the dice on the map before they resolve.

—description from the publisher

Name: UCF (fan expansion for Formula D)
Description:
This is a fan-made track for the Formula D board game, featuring two alternate routes on and around the UCF campus.

It was created as a gift for a friend of mine, Stephen Eckman.

—description from the designer

Name: Voll Verwackelt
Description:
Tim Löwe and his friends have found the tastiest coconuts imaginable, but unfortunately these coveted fruits are growing on a palm tree that stands in the middle of a shaky rock.

In Voll Verwackelt, players must balance the animals constantly as they move them gently across this unstable rock because only if the balance is kept do you receive coconuts as a reward. Collect the most coconuts by the end of the game, and you win!

Name: Blood Red Skies: Hawker Hurricane Squadron
Description:
During the Battle of Britain, The RAF had more Hurricanes than Spitfires, and the rugged Hurricanes shot down more enemy planes than their glamorous stable-mate. As the battlefield intensified in Northern Europe, Hurricanes went on to see extensive action in Africa, the Pacific, and Eastern fronts.

This is an expansion set for the WWII aircraft miniatures game Blood Red Skies by Warlord Games and designed by Andy Chambers. This expansion includes a squadron of Hawker Hurricane fighters, and additional accessories to add to the core game.

Components included in this expansion are:
6 Single engine British aircraft
6 Advantage Flying Bases
1 Aircraft Card
6 Aircraft Trait Cards
6 Double-sided Pilot Skill Discs
1 Aircraft Markings Sticker Sheet
3 Action Cards

Scale: 1/200th
Families: Game: Blood Red Skies – Royal Air Force

Name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: A Feat of Arms
Description:
"Defeat? I do not recognize the meaning of the word." – Margaret Thatcher April 1982, start of the Falklands War

In April of 1982, Argentina invaded the British sovereign territory of the Falkland Islands, in the South Atlantic. The Argentines had long claimed ownership of the islands, which they called Islas Malvinas. The unforeseen attack and occupation sparked international outrage, and Great Britain quickly mobilized a naval task force to retake the islands, 8,000 miles from home. Relying on the élan of their professional and highly trained military personnel, the combined air, sea and land forces succeeded against the odds, victorious less than 80 days from the Argentine seizure of the islands. For the British, it was no less than a spectacular feat of arms.

A Feat of Arms is an expansion module for Lock ’n Load Tactical: Heroes of the Falklands. Play 12 scenarios on six new X-Maps, including a new Port Stanley Map for a revised take on Operation Rosario, the initial Argentine invasion. Other new terrain includes rugged hills—for new battles on Mt. Harriet, Wireless Ridge and Sapper Hill—and a grass airfield, for the SAS’s audacious raid on Pebble Island and the ferocious final action of the Battle of Goose Green. Across the islands, the bold British Paras and Royal Marines fought well-armed Argentine Army conscripts and Marines defending vital terrain and counterattacking upon lost ground. The conditions were harsh, with most of the fighting done at night, among minefields and under heavy mortar and artillery fire.

The Falklands War was a test of mettle. Are you up to the test?

—description from the publisher

Name: Blanc-Manger Coco: Pot de départ
Description:
Pot de départ is a work-themed Blanc-Manger Coco deck.
It contains 160 reply cards and 40 question cards.

Name: Blanc-Manger Coco: Salade, Tomate, Oignon
Description:
Additional food-themed Blanc-Manger Coco deck.

Mix the cards or not with the other games in the range: you decide.

Contains 160 reply cards and 40 question cards.

Name: Think It Up! Pictures
Description:
What do you see in the picture? A wolf or a dog? A beast or a pet? Would you call a rundown building a hut or a cabin? Or, maybe, a shack? In this game, all your answers are correct and victorious as long as you are fast enough.

Think It Up! Pictures is a great game both for a party and for a family gathering. Each round, you draw two cards: one from the theme deck and one from the picture deck. Your aim is to be the first to come up with a word for the object in the picture, then use its first letter to recall the right word for the theme. The themes are created in such a way that they would be understood by a child, and you don't have to be the most erudite — just the most quick-witted!

Name: Meine ersten Spiele: Beim Kinderarzt
Description:
At Dr. Liebherz's office, there is never a dull moment: Linus has come for his vaccination, Greta has had an accident, and Emma has a cough.

In Meine ersten Spiele: Beim Kinderarzt the players help the doctor to make her little patients feel better. In free play, the players familiarize themselves with the instruments. The actual game has simple rules requiring a good memory because the players are now allowed to help treat the patients. And in the interactive game narrative, they can experience a fascinating day at the doctor's office.

—description from the publisher

Name: Saga: Book of Battles
Description:
The Book of Battles is an unusual supplement. It is not a SAGA Universe, but a collection of scenarios and game variants that can be applied to any Universe in which you decide to play. It is therefore a perfect complement to the Saga 2nd Edition rule book, a companion that enlarges its horizons by proposing alternatives to the basic Clash of Warlords scenario.

The Book of Battles is divided into five sections:

     Skirmishes
     Battles
     Legends
     Mass Battles
     Sagas

Name: Länder Europas
Description:
The bus is crisscrossing Europe, passing through 51 countries. No wonder the tourists are gradually becoming disoriented. Can you figure out what country you are in?

In Länder Europas', the sooner a country is correctly identified, the more points will be awarded. The player who knows the map of Europe best and can get their tourist around the board first wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Polly Pudel
Description:
In the area of the park where people come to exercise their dogs, the owners are desperately looking for their pets and urgently need help.

In Polly Pudel, the players have to look closely to find out which hind quarters go with which dog, then they need to act quickly. But be careful as some dogs look confusingly similar! The player who finds the most matching dogs wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Floaty Fight!
Description:
In Floaty Fight!, a.k.a. Schiffe versenken, players need guesswork and their powers of deduction to discover the whereabouts of all the opponent's floaties to win the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Race to the Moon
Description:
A spin and move game to see who can reach the moon first. Produced in 1959 possible as a supplement or to promote Dell Comics.
Players follow their individual paths from the Launch platform on earth to the moon, moving by the count of a spinner. A player may encounter setbacks and advances as they proceed along their path. A number of space stations along the way give a player an extra turn. The winner is the first to reach the moon.

Name: Home Run Dice
Description:
A new abstract strategy game, where a unique dice roll and a unique gameboard offers a unique challenge for up to four players. Escape with your dice to the nest on the other side and knock out your opponent’s dice on the way. It is not possible to make diagonal moves and the dice are moved by the number on the top but it must be rotated a quarter of a turn as well. So, the next move will be able to move a different amount of steps. IF IT IS POSSIBLE YOU CAN EAT OPPONENTS UNITS WITH A HORSE JUMP . L . POSSIBLE TO EAT AS MANY AS YOU CAN IF MORE THAN ONE HORSE JUMP IS POSSIBLE

—description from the designer

Name: Air Bears
Description:
If you are in luck and plan your flights well in Urlaubär: Inselrennen, you can get your bears to their holiday destination first and win the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mein Schulranzen-Memo
Description:
School is going to begin soon, and it is time to pack your backpack! Who has a good memory and can best remember where the books, scissors, and sandwiches are? The first player in Mein Schulranzen-Memo to arrange a backpack using six tiles wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Flug zum Mond
Description:
German game published as a special supplement in the Housewife's Journal in 1940.

A simple roll and move game where players start from earth centered in the middle of the board and race along 112 squares to reach the moon. The playing pieces are cut out hot air balloons. Along the way players can advance or be penalized on certain numbered spots.

Translated as 'Flight to the Moon' this German game has beautiful color illustrations, and written down the bottom is special supplement to 'The Leaf of the Housewife' (gr.1886) 54th year (1940).

—user summary

Name: Unsere Jahreszeiten
Description:
The seasons are completely mixed up!

In Unsere Jahreszeiten, the players help get the season tiles in the right order again. The player who has a good memory and is lucky when spinning the disk will be the first one to place four different tiles in front of them and win.

—description from the publisher

Name: Zahlenreihe
Description:
While playing in the forest, the animal friends have mixed up the many number tiles. Now the players have to get the numbers back in the right sequence. They need some luck when turning tiles over and have to remember which tiles the other players have turned over. The first player in Zahlenreihe to lay out a sequence of eight consecutive number tiles wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Buchstaben: Domino
Description:
There's always something happening in Buchstaben: Domino: First, Dragon Dave is making his rounds on the domino cards, and then there's word chaos in Dragonland and the domino cards must be put in the right order. You will be able to expand your spelling and vocabulary, which will help you win the Dragon Race or ABC Dominoes games.

—description from the publisher

Name: メテオ回収株式会社 (Meteo Inc)
Description:
In ãƒ¡ãƒ†ã‚ªå›žåŽæ ªå¼ä¼šç¤¾ (Meteor Recovery Co., Ltd.), each player controls a robot that roams an asteroid mining the meteors that hit it. Players take 2 actions per turn, and can walk 2 spaces, acquire a technology card, "reboot" their robot if it has fallen, or acquire ore from a meteor dice. Players can also pay for additional special actions with ore they have collected.  Once a meteor has been acquired, the die hits the asteroid again by the player dropping it from a height of at least 16cm. The first player to obtain a certain amount of the large yellow ore, depending upon player count, wins.

—user summary

Name: Mini Race
Description:
Who will be the first to make two laps and cross the finish line? With some luck rolling the dice in Mini Race, you can earn the coveted turbo chips to boost your car ahead.

—description from the publisher

Name: T-Rex
Description:
The dinosaurs are out! Now we need true dinosaur experts who don't lose track of things during their turbulent search.

In T-Rex, the two dice decide which dinosaur is sought. Which player will find the correct matching dinosaur and can hold onto it and protect it during the game?

—description from the publisher

Name: Mini Miez
Description:
Which player has a lucky hand and will drop the cat chips skillfully? In Mini Miez, players may drop different numbers of cat chips from their hands and, with a little luck, will manage to get the right number of cats.

—description from the publisher

Name: Glücksfee
Description:
Who will be the first player in Glücksfee to float their wooden fairy figure over the magic wands to the finish line? Some luck and clever guesses will earn players more wands and make their fairies fly the farthest to beat the opponents.

—description from the publisher

Name: Koty i Myszy
Description:
In a certain old house, mice began to love. These little creatures, although friendly-looking, cause a lot of damage to a household storeroom. Guarding it are two fat, fluffy cats who keep the food secure and try to catch as many mice as they can.
—description from the rulebook (translated)

One player plays as the Mice (12) and one player plays as the cats (2). Mice tries to get to the Yellow spaces near the cat player's base (purple spaces are mouse traps): Mice can not move backwards and can also not jump over another pawn. The cats capture mice by jumping over it like in checkers or halma, and can capture multiple mice provided there is an empty space between them to land on.

The game ends when there are no mice on white, blue or orange spaces, and the winner is the player with most points:
1 point for the Mouse player for each mouse who entered the Storeroom (yellow spaces)
1 point for the Cat player for each captured mouse
—user summary

Name: Middle-Earth Strategy Battle Game: Armies of the Hobbit
Description:
The Armies of The Hobbit is an expansion for the Middle-earth Strategy Battle Game that enables you to recreate your favourite scenes from The Hobbit Motion Picture Trilogy with your collection. The 160-page hardback book includes all the information you need to take control of all the Heroes and armies on the tabletop:


     13 army lists for the forces of Good, including a brief background, points values, characteristics, special rules and Heroic Tiers for the following: Thorin's Company; Army of Thror; The Iron Hills; Erebor Reclaimed; Army of Lake-town; Survivors of Lake-town; Garrison of Dale; Rivendell; Halls of Thranduil; Radagast's Alliance; The Misty Mountains; The White Council; Wanderers in the Wild;


- 7 army lists for the forces of Evil, including a brief background, points values, characteristics, special rules and Heroic Tiers for the following: Azog's Legion; Azog's Hunters; Dark Powers of Dol Guldur; Dark Denizens of Mirkwood; Goblin-town; The Trolls; Desolator of the North;

     11 Narrative Play Scenarios based on pivotal battles: Destruction of Dale; Battle of Azanulbizar; Roast Mutton; Hunting Party; Escape from Goblin-town; Out of the Frying Pan, and into the Fire; Flies and Spiders; Fire and Water; The Fall of the Necromancer; Battle of the Five Armies; Battle for Dale;
     A full Allies Matrix, showing which factions can work together;
     Army Bonuses for every faction;
     Profiles providing rules for your favourite Heroes, Villains, Monsters and Warriors.


—description from the publisher

Name: フリップオーバー (FLIP OVER)
Norges Saga
Description:
The game consists of six boards with nine pictures of events from Norwegian history (with the year of the event printed on them), 54 cards with the same pictures, and a list of descriptions of the factual events. The players get one or more boards each (depending on the numbers of players) and draw cards. If they can correctly identify the historical events depicted, they get to keep the card. The goal is to fill you board.

—user summary

Name: Culdcept: The Card Game
Description:
A 1997 Japanese promo game to promote the Sega Saturn Culdcept game, only 500 in existence!
Created by Hobby Japan, Omiya Soft and Sega.
Based on the Sega Saturn game cards and rules.

Like the 1997 Sega Saturn video game, Culdcept the card game is a mix of Monopoly and Magic The Gathering.
Player summon monsters, cast spells and try to occupy as much land as possible.

—user summary

Name: Tante Anna!
Description:
The first player to roll a 6 is aunt Anna's escort and places his pawn in the center of the game board. The other players place their pawns on any space (luck symbol) on the ring of their color. Then the escort player places aunt Anna on a heart in a column where no pawn is standing and rolls the die. He may move aunt Anna in any direction according to the result of the roll. If aunt Anna lands on a column with one ore more pawns, the player of each pawn has to pay a token, which is placed inside the hollow aunt Anna figure and the escort rolls again. If aunt Anna lands on a column with no pawns, the next player gets his turn. He rolls the die and moves his pawn clockwise. If he lands in the same column as aunt Anna, he gets chosen to be her new escort, if not, the next player has his turn. If a new escort has been chosen, the abandoned escort gets all tokens inside aunt Anna and her new escort gets to move her to collect tokens for him.

The game ends if one player looses all his tokens. The player with the most tokens wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Hail of Fire: WWII Company-Level Miniatures Warfare Rules
Description:
Hail Of Fire is a company-level, WWII themed miniatures war game designed to be both simple and easy to learn while keeping both players engaged in the action! And best of all, the rules are only few pages long! So print out the PDF, throw some models on the table, and jump right into the exciting tabletop combat!

Using a fast, interactive turn sequence, players are always in the fight. The addition of hidden action points, fast and easy deployment, and a delayed combat resolution system ensures that both commanders will be fighting the friction and fog of war as much as they are each other!

—description from publisher

Name: VILNIUS
Description:
Defend the City of Vilnius against the German Knights that want to conquer your home. Each round in VILNIUS you have to decide whether you will develop your quarter (civil action) or prepare to fight against the foreign warriors (military action). The more civil buildings you build, the stronger the Knights become, but your co-operative partners will help you to defend. If you are not strong enough, the Knights destroy buildings or parts of the city wall that all players commonly defend.

The players are succeed if the city wall can be defended until the pile is empty for second and third time. They lose if Vilnius falls.

—description from the publisher

Name: FlamingOs Card Game
Description:
Get tropical with FlamingOs! Pair, swoop, block, and steal to win!

FlamingOs is a fun card game for 2–5 players. Players take turns drawing cards and pairing mingos to earn shrimp. 10 shrimp points earn a player 1 'O' card. (Shrimp cards are worth 1 point, Jumbo Shrimp cards are worth 5 points.) The first player to get 3 'O' cards wins. But watch out! There are Sharks, Pelicans, a Crab, Seagulls, and special Shrimp that can help or hurt a player’s advancement to win.
 FlamingOs takes less than 5 minutes to learn and plays about 20–40 minutes.

Name: Defenders of the Last Stand: Kickstarter Promo Pack
Description:
Defenders of the Last Stand Promo features:

4 New Heroes

4 Miniatures

12 Cards

Name: Ultimate Secret File
Description:
A bomb has been located near the world biggest nuclear facilities. Time is missing and you need to crack a code in order to defuse the bomb. The world is counting on you, good luck! Find the password, save the world.

A 1 to 6 players cooperative game

+  If you play solo, you have 30 minutes to find the solution.

+ If you are 2 players, you have 15 minutes to find the solution.

+  If you are 3 players, you have 10 minutes to find the solution.

+ If you are 4 players, you have 8 minutes to find the solution.

+  If you are 5 players, you have 6 minutes to find the solution.

+ If you are 6 players, you have 5 minutes to find the solution.

Simple rules 
1) You have the rules, a code to crack and a zip bag. 
2) Take a pen with some paper. 
3) To defuse the bomb, you need to crack the code. 
4) According to your sources, the solution is a five-letter word. 
5) When you are ready, launch the timer and open the zip bag. 
6) Try to crack the code and find the solution. 
7) To check the solution, open the tiny envelop. 
8) If you find the solution before the end of the timer, you win.

Name: Hostage Negotiator: Career
Description:
Hostage Negotiator: Career is an expansion for the Hostage Negotiator system that requires the Hostage Negotiator base game, Hostage Negotiator: Crime Wave, and multiple Abductor Packs to play.

In this culmination of the Hostage Negotiator series, you will play ten years in the life of a negotiator — that is, if you don't retire in shame sooner. In each "year" or campaign round of the game, you will resolve a career card that presents you with some narrative event that relates to or could impact your career based on the choice you make. Then, in most but not all years, you will be called to the scene of the latest hostage situation. Now, the result of each negotiation will impact the overall campaign and you'll be tracking your career stress, your personal stress, your merit level (for promotions), and your rank, among other things.

After the negotiation, you resolve a personal card and are once again faced with a narrative event to resolve and, based on the result of your negotiation in that "year", will be rewarded (or reprimanded) accordingly.

Name: Sheep, Sheep and Sheep
Description:
"Sheep Pasture" is a big farm with several large flocks of long-haired black sheep and white sheep. Because the farmer takes care of them with love, the sheep are fat and furry. Therefore, the big wolves see such beautiful sheep as delicious food. Can you help the farmer to count the sheep and chase the big wolves away?

To set up Sheep, Sheep and Sheep, a.k.a. å¹¾éš»ç¾Š, deal the deck of pasture cards evenly among all players. Create a space in the center of the playing area that's about two cards long by two cards wide. Flip up enough cards from players' decks that the pasture has four cards in it.

On a turn, a player points to where they want to place a pasture card, then flips over a card from their deck into this space on top of any other cards there. Whoever first calls out the correct number of visible sheep on pasture cards receives a point tile as a reward. Once all the point tiles have been handed out, the game ends and whoever has collected the most of them wins.

Name: The Battle of Lizard
Description:
In The Battle of Lizard, a.k.a. èœ¥è“‹, players each control a group of lizards on an island competing for survival — long-term survival, that is, because when breeding time arrives, these male lizards (Uta stansburiana) will fight one another for land and the right to reproduction. To succeed, you need to block others to keep them from reproducing!

To set up the game, shuffle the cards, then deal everyone a hand of six cards, placing the other cards aside as a draw deck. Players then take turns playing a card from their hand onto the table in the breeding competition area, then refilling their hand. Cards may be rotated, but not flipped over, and a player may choose to cover other cards or place their card next to others.

As soon as someone creates a chain of five identical lizards either orthogonally or diagonally, the game ends and the player who owns this color of lizard wins. If players run out of cards, they take turns moving uncovered cards to connect or cover other cards until someone wins.

Name: Prairie of Beetles
Description:
You're wandering in a rich and vast prairie filled with lots of colorful beetles. Choose your tool correctly to catch these beetles. Don't mess around or the beetles may be hurt and run away!

To set up Prairie of Beetles, a.k.a. èŸ²èŸ²æ‹æ‹, shuffle the beetle cards, then scatter them face down in the middle of the table. Place a net or cage card between each pair of players. Players then take turns flipping over the beetle cards, and as soon as someone flips over a card that matches another one, everyone races to place one hand on the target beetle card and one hand on the corresponding net or cage card.

Once all the beetle cards have been turned face up, the game ends, and whoever has collected the most beetle cards wins.

Name: Roll for the Galaxy: Rivalry
Description:
Roll for the Galaxy: Rivalry, the second expansion for Roll for the Galaxy, consists of three expansions in one box.

First, it adds expansion content to the base game: 62 more game dice, a new die type, start factions, home worlds, and more than double the number of game tiles for the bag as in Ambition, the first expansion for Roll. This material is compatible with Ambition, but that expansion is not required to play Rivalry. If you are familiar with the dice from Ambition, then you can add this content and start playing immediately. (If not, you'll need to read about the new dice.)

Rivalry also contains two optional game modules — the Deal Game and the Orb Game — which can be played separately or combined. These modules can also be combined with the goals in Ambition, although the publisher suggests not combining them all at once for new players!

• The Deal Game has a new deal phase in which players assign $ dice to a new deal board in order to swap assets they don't want for those they do — and pretty much everything is fair game in terms of possible trades. Not using all your credit track? Why not trade in the top part of it to get a useful die? Or, if you're running a large economy and need a credit track that goes to 11 (or even 16), why not trade away a couple of white dice to get a larger track?

Have a bunch of extra tiles clogging up your construction zones from previous Explores? Why not trade them in for new dice? Or, a chance to draw from the bag until you find a 6 cost development? Or a pair of VP chips? Or a talent counter? Or some credits? Or, another Leader die? Or, a chance to draw a world of a desired color from the bag? Or, to turn some Citizenry dice directly into Developers or Settlers? Or...

Seven deal dice are rolled each turn before players assign their workers to determine what asset types can be potentially gained or traded in that round. After you swap assets, your deal will start to mature over several rounds. If you (or someone else) calls "Deal" again before your deal expires, then you might want to send another dealer in to reverse your trade, trading back for what you originally spent and making some credits and talent counters along the way. Of course, while your deal is maturing, some other player might swoop in and reverse it before you wanted to, taking their cut and converting your attempted temporary loan into a permanent exchange. These things happen...

• The Orb Game gives one yellow "Alien Orb" die to each player, and the faces of these dice can be popped out and upgraded to various "lines" of faces that allow you to customize what you can do in the game. (Think of the lines as being akin to a tech tree.)

You can assign dice to become researchers in the Research phase, and for each assigned researcher, when someone calls Research, you get two "dots" of upgrades to your dice. The first dot gets you a 1-dot face in any line; extra dots get you better faces in that line. (If you want to switch lines for a given face after entering a line, pay 1 dot more.) These upgraded dice affect your play. For example, if you roll the 2-dot beige -1 develop face, you receive a -1 die discount on all developments you build that turn.

Orb dice are rolled in front of player screens at the start of a round. If, for example, you roll a face that grants virtual workers, then everyone knows that you will benefit if Explore occurs and can plan accordingly as they assign their dice and decide which phase to call.

To allow improved Orb dice more opportunities to affect play, the Orb game ends at 15+ tiles or when the initial VP chip pool is exhausted, which is increased to 15 VPs per player. At game end, each 2-dot and 4-dot face on your Orb die is worth 1 and 2 VPs, respectively.

• Replacement player screens including a summary of the optional games (in different colored type faces) and all three added dice types are also included.

Name: Trivial Anime
Description: This game is a Trivial game about anime where the players have to show how much knowledge they have about this topic. The players have to complete their anime character in order to win.

Name: The Little Flower Shop: Potpourri Pack
Description:
This 12-card expansion pack adds some variety to the Little Flower Shop.  At the start of the game, 3 potpourri cards are dealt to each player.  In typical drafting form, players keep 1 and pass 2. They then keep 1 of the 2 received and pass the 3rd card.

The potpourri cards give players an opportunity to score additional flower power or to earn money by meeting a variety of conditions.  Some cards also just give an immediate bonus.  While some of the cards are played during the game, others are scored at game end.

The cards can also be used in the solo game as a way to increase one's score.

Name: Speed Chess
Description:
In Speed Chess, you have only six pieces with which to play: three pawns, a knight, a bishop and a king. It requires fewer moves, but also a great deal of skill in order to trap the opponent's king. Since the chess board is not square, it presents opportunities for new strategies and clever moves. Furthermore, Speed Chess is much faster than traditional chess, which means you will need to think fast to keep your opponent in...umm...check!

—description from the publisher

Name: Sensei Clash
Description:
Sensei Clash is a 2 player game where you'll need to master the figthing styles of the snake, owl and tiger to trick your opponent and win.
You'll be placing cards upside down every turn and then revealing them simultaniously to see the amazing or terrible outcome your movements have had.
The first one that strikes its opponent down to 0 health will win the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – "Adventure in Neverland" Junior Scenario
Description:
It is called Adventures in Neverland and is - obviously - inspired by Peter Pan story. This family-oriented scenario let players fight Captain Hook, feed TikTak gator and do all things inspired by the book. It's filled with theme and kids who know the story will be in heaven. 
—description from the publisher

A fourteenth scenario, included in the loot box. It is an introduction to Robinson Crusoe: Mystery Tales.
—description from the publisher
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Peter Pan
Game: Robinson Crusoe – Adventures on the Cursed Island

Name: The Grimm Forest: Enchanted Ale Promo Card
Description:
The English version of this promo card was available through the Secret Cabal 2018 Kickstarter campaign.

The card text:

When Revealed: Shuffle your unused Gather Cards and randomly choose a new one. At the end of the Gather Phase, if you are alone in a location gain 1 resource of your choice. If you are in a location with another player gain 1 Friend.

Name: Cry Havoc: Tactic & Sabotage Crystals
Description:
Increase your Cry Havoc collection and add a set of cool crystals to it! They are not your average, everyday crystals. They are special crystals, that add new rules to the game, increasing its strategic aspect. Before the game distribute them on all regions. One type of those new crystals increases the Region value, the other decreases it. That change in Region’s value will mean you would need to play your whole game differently!

New Crystals is a very simple mini-expansion that adds a ton of strategy to the game. In the setup phase, players will plant different regions with white and black crystals. Unlike the ones from the base game, these black and white are one use only, sort of objectives to grab, secure and score. And unlike the ones from the base game, white and black crystals are located precisely where you want them to be. You set the scene. You prepare the game. You let other players know which region is vital for you. After the setup phase is over, the board is filled with white and black crystals, markers that manifest players plans. For winning in the region with white crystals, you get additional points. If you win in a region with black ones, the score for this battle will be lower. The map gets extra dimension, unique net of scoring opportunities plant on the board by players themselves.

Name: Let's Make a Deal
Description:
There are four rounds of play. During the first three rounds each player will play one at a time. The voice of Monty Hall, the developer of the television series and its original host, will offer each player three deals. The player will start with one prize and will have the opportunity to keep or trade for a second and third prize. It is possible to trade for a Zonk, a worthless prize. A player ends one’s turn by trading for a Zonk. A player only has seven seconds to make each decision. Using up too much time results in a Zonk.

The fourth round is the Big Deal of the Day. The unit will reveal the scores of the players and ask each if one wants to trade in everything one for one final deal. The unit will announce which player has won when this round has ended.

—user summary

Name: Yas Queen!
Description:
Yas Queen is a quick, fun game where you are as a Drag Superstar looking to plan your weekend performances. The game is played in 3 rounds - Friday Night, Saturday Night, and Sunday Brunch. Each round presents players with a number of venues, where they must assemble their fellow queens to perform at.

Not all venues are equal, though. Some (such as the the Retirement Center) want Queens who can sing Broadway classics, while others (such as the Nightclub) want Queens who can dance. Each Queen specializes in a different talent, so you must be strategic about who you send where.

But watch out! Player interaction becomes paramount as your opponents "Throw Shade" (by literally throwing cards at you) and try to ruin your performances! Will you can overcome that by "Spilling the T."

Yas Queen is a quick, lighthearted game that will have everyone yelling "YASSS QUEEN!"

—description from the publisher

Name: Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Faerun Under Siege – Collector's Box
Description:
Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Faerûn Under Siege is a game that utilizes WizKids Games' proprietary Dice Building Game platform in which two players take the role of warlords, collect and assemble their "party" of adventurer dice and battle in head-to-head gameplay. Each turn, players roll the dice to see what resources they have available, buy dice, send their party members into the field, and then strike at the enemy warlord. There are multiple cards available for each type of die so players get to choose which one to use. This lets players specialize dice to suit play style.

Additional cards and dice to expand your collection can be found in expansion packs. Each Foil Pack contains two cards and two dice that players can add to their Dice Masters Faerûn Under Siege collections. Players can create teams of their favorite fantasy characters from the Forgotten Realms universe.

The D&D Dice Masters: Faerun Under Seige Collector's Box, This box contains: 20 Custom Dice, 1 Full Color Cloth Dice Bag, 10 Basic Action Cards, 4 Reminder Cards, 1 Full Art Promo Card, and 2 Dice Storage Trays that hold over 300 dice!

Name: Campaign for President
Description: This is a light dice and card game about running to become the President of the United States. Players are candidates on the road to the White House and the game revolves around your political campaign's ability to woo voters before Election Day. Player candidates play cards in an attempt to maintain political momentum by rallying support while diverting that same momentum away from rival candidates. Through a classic draw-and-play mechanic, players can challenge each other to debates, attack one another’s public integrity, or directly appeal to the voters for support in their bid to become President. When the Election Day card is drawn, time is up and the candidate who gathered the most voters will win.

Name: Parliament 2050
Description:
Parliament is a politics themed strategy card game for 3-4 players. It involves the brinksmanship of poker, the contingency planning of chess, and the haggling of a used car purchase.
Each player represents a political party, and each party has different, but overlapping, voting preferences on various issue categories. The preferences are balanced so that no party has a greater likelihood of victory than any other.

Each player receives several points cards which indicate the points they will score for winning a given issue. Some are dealt face up and some are dealt face down, giving other players incomplete information about how much their rivals stand to gain on any given vote.
 Each round, players take turns nominating issues and casting votes in a rotating order.

Players can only cast a limited number of votes each round, which they must ration carefully.

Throughout the game, players can form voting pacts with each otherâ€•however, the pacts are non-binding and so betrayal is always possible.

Name: Eine lehrreiche Kometenfahrt
Description:
Eine lehrreiche Kometenfahrt ("An instructive comet ride")was a promotional game to advertise the German company Torol and its gas lights products.
This roll and move game has players travelling through the solar system, starting at the sun and finishing at Neptune. Pluto is mentioned as a newly discovered planet (discovered 1930) but is out of order from the other celestial bodies. The game is instructive giving information about the planets.
Players begin by paying 2 Marks to the cashier and may add to the pool by landing on certain worlds. Some planets may give an extra throw of the dice. While asteroids or Halleys comet can send you forward or backwards. The winner is the first to land by exact count (number 120) on Neptune and collects the cashiers total.

—user summary

Name: Little Panic Island
Description:
The cooperative party-game for children !

In Little Panic Island, children are immersed in a cooperative game mixing memory, speed and fun, all in… 2 minutes ! Progress together in this evolutionary game with 3 levels of difficulty.

All together, you have 2 minutes to find all Cro-Magnons and Dodods by flipping 2 tiles to try to have a pair. But be carefull, the monkeys have hiden funny traps to slow you down.

Name: Resident Evil 2: The Board Game – B-Files Expansion
Description:
The B-Files expansion brings six new action-packed scenarios to Resident Evil 2: The Board Game, providing players with new enemies, areas, events, items and over nine hours of additional gameplay. Just like before, you’ll have to work with your allies in order to survive – but beware, these scenarios will provide a harsher challenge and introduce a relentless new adversary who will ruthlessly pursue you from game to game…

—description from the publisher

Name: The Exciting Outta-Space Game
Description:
The object of the game is for each player to complete as many orbits around the earth as possible without stopping on the space that sends the capsule back to earth.
Each player has a coloured space capsule and with the use of a spinner can send their capsule into orbit. During play the player may lose of gain a turn, advance their orbit or maybe returned to earth. If returned to earth the player still retains the number of orbits that was completed. The player can then return to orbit on the correct spin.
The game is played for a predetermined time, or go back into orbit a predetermined number of times. The player with the most orbits is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Ten Frame Towers
Description:
Stack your Ten Frame Tower with as many number bonds to 10 as you can to win.  Challenge your friends to see who can stack the highest tower.

How To Play:

     Roll the dice and take your tiles
     Stack number bonds to 10
     Person with the highest tower wins!


—description from the publisher

Name: Rocket Satellite Action Game
Description:
A three-dimensional game of skill to pilot a rocket ship to explore outer space. Published in the mid to late 1950s. The colorful board has planets and other cosmic objects viewed from inside a spaceship. Plastic spacecraft are guided along a space path using a magnetic control device. Points are scored either by flying successful legs of the journey, being penalized for going off course or hitting a Space Port or racing the course under a set time. The player with the most points or fastest time is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Kerfuffle
Description:
Abstract card game for two or more players (up two per deck).

Each player has a deck of 25 cards, each containing five copies of five different cards. Each card has a special action that it performs, which either helps the player using it or hinders another player.

On a player's turn, they play one of the cards from their hand in front of them, and then perform the special action associated with that type of card.

The first player to assemble either one card of all five types or five cards of the same type wins.

While the rules are in English, the cards used in the game itself consist purely of an icon, meaning that the game is effectively language independent. Given the large nature of these icons and the colour choices, it's also no problem for colorblind players.

'-description from designer

Name: Trump Cards
Description:
This game puts politics aside and simply tests your skills at weeding out fake news from real news. Two to ten players take turns reading out cards. Think the president really said it? Play the “Approved” card. Think it’s made up? Use the “Fake News” card.

One point is granted to each player for correct responses, but if no player is correct, the reader gets one point.

Win the game by being the first player to reach 5 points.

All “real” Trump quotes are properly sourced to prevent arguments.

Name: Mythos: Vengeance of Ognyan
Description:
Mythos: Vengeance of Ognyan is a combat-driven and strategy dependent RPG board game. It follows the steps of three heroes, who set out to slay a legendary Zmey, who has risen from the grave. Vengeance of Ognyan is a core-set and includes everything you need to play in a total of 4 game modes!

During the Vengeance of Ognyan campaign, players will be able to pick one of three available heroes to venture out alone or in a party with one goal: to slay Ognyan once and for all. Each character has their own mechanics and relations to the others. Every one of them has their own die, stats and skill trees. During turns, players will have a chance to move and then initiate combat, but dice will determine the success of their announced actions. Positioning also plays a large part of strategizing your way to victory: while standing next to specific characters, you gain different buffs or debuffs.

During the Campaign players will follow open-ended quest-lines, which can lead them through different routes to victory or failure. Each quest is tied to a location and a setup. Every location has its own rule set. You place your heroes, arrange the enemies and proceed with combat until you achieve victory. That can mean different things, depending on your current quest goal - like slaying all enemies or surviving an onslaught for a given number of turns. During a campaign run, players will have to complete numerous encounters, cleanse dungeons and participate in many events before the party reaches Ognyan’s Lair. You can also invite a more experienced fourth player to join you and act as your guide through the world of Mythos, but if you do – their word becomes the law of the game, as long as it’s fun for everyone!

With every battle, the heroes grow stronger through a leveling system. If a player can bank enough experience tokens, their hero can level up. The player will have to choose one of two available skill options and with each choice their hero will become a unique result of their play through. But watch out – enemies gain levels proportionally to the party as well!

After you've mastered the game's rules and mechanics, you can try one of the other game modes present: Ognyan Unleashed, RNG Challenges and Player versus Player Combat are there for more experienced adventurers or those, who are looking for a fast battle without context. Better yet - now that you have these tools at your disposal, you can design your very own epic adventures and share them with the Ognyan Slayers community for a chance to win awesome rewards!

The World of Mythos awaits you. It's time you rise and put an end to Ognyan's tyrannical reign once and for all!

You can have a look at the Mythos: Vengeance of Ognyan public rule book here: http://1am.studio/Mythos-Vengeance_of_Ognyan_DigitalRulebook.pdf


    The Vengeance of Ognyan core-set is the based on the "Mythos" franchise by 1AM Studios, which is inspired by ancient Slavic mythology.


—description from the publisher

Name: Normandía: El desembarco
Description:
Spanish wargame about the Allied invasion of Europe during the WWII.

Components:
-Map of 60 x 45 cm
-310 counters
-Booklet rules in spanish
1 die

Name: Alien Artifacts: Alien Base Promo
Description:
Alien Base is a set of 4 double-sided tiles. On one side of each tile, you have a picture of a fragment of a base. If you put these tiles face down, they together form a big alien base.

On the other side of each tile, there is an alien threat you must fight. Spyware threat blocks your technology cards, Alien contamination threat blocks your ships and Mysterious plague will affect your planets…

With this promo in game players have a choice – instead of attacking Alien system card, they may attack Alien Base, choose one of the tiles, flip it face up and fight it. You never know which part of the base you will have to deal with. They are a mystery. They are a risk. They are a threat!

But the award is there. On score 2, 3, or 4 you will gain Victory Point.

Save humanity. Fight Alien Base.
